title: Married Life in Krishna Consciousness Movement | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 3.22.11 | 13.08.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: The household duty of a man is not to satisfy his sense gratification but to remain with a wife and children and at the same time attain Advancement in Spiritual Life
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difference between a true householder (Grahastha) and one who is simply attached to household life (Grahamedhi), emphasizing spiritual advancement.
segments.transcript: प्रापरपोर्ट बाईज़ जबाएन ग्रेसे एसे बक्ति वेदामत स्वामी श्रील प्रापा अथ के जाएäre translation therefore please accept her O chief of the brahmanas, for I offer her with faith and she is in every respect fit to be your wife and take charge of your household duties. Purport by Shrila Prabhupada: the words ग्रह में दिशु कर्म सुमीन in household duties, another word is also used here सर्वात्म नानु रूपाम. The purport is that a wife should not only be equal to her husband in age, character, and qualities, but must be helpful to him in his household duties. The household duty of a man is not to satisfy his sense gratification, but to remain with a wife and children and at the same time attain advancement in spiritual life. We have to follow those ashrama principles.

segments.key_quote: Where there is chanting, maya cannot enter.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how chanting the Hare Krishna mantra protects devotees from the anxieties of material existence, especially in Kali Yuga, and provides a unique, sheltered environment.
segments.transcript: At the same time, for the outside world we have to set an example, so we have to be very, very careful. Even though we know that there is nothing, there is no perfect ashrama that can be followed in the present environment. But those who chant the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra, those who serve the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra, because the spiritual potency comes from the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra, one will be able to, in whatever ashram he is there, he will be able to easily follow those principles. Even if the environment is not there, in a sense he will be able to follow all those things. There is no difficulty for a devotee who is chanting sixteen rounds to follow the principles of any of these ashramas. Not at all difficult, because the holy name is so powerful. Chanting is so powerful. It is not that you chant Hare Krishna sixteen rounds and your material life is in a mess. It will not be like that. The chanting of Hare Krishna is so powerful that it will, in the midst of all this, just like look at the devotees in Hare Krishna hill or any of our temples. The outside world is such a big mess. And here devotees have no such thing. They are simply chanting, dancing, doing their service. Anxieties of struggle for existence is being spared for everybody in this Hare Krishna hill. How is it possible in Kali Yuga? Where will you get this luxury in Kali Yuga? Where you don't have to think about your eating, sleeping, waiting, defending. You don't have to think. You only think of serving Prabhupada, serving Prabhupada. Your whole life gets going. Nowhere, because material energy does not allow that. Maya does not allow that, because maya cannot enter when there is Sankirtana. Where there is chanting, maya cannot enter. So we keep ourselves under protection of the divine energy of the deities, of the holy name of Guru's mercy. By all these things we are actually continuously on a day to day basis we are protected and that is why we are in this particular situation.
